title: Match of the Day analysis: Why Burnley winger Dwight McNeil impressed Alan Shearer
description: Alan Shearer analyses Dwight McNeil's performance against Everton and says the Burnley winger "probably won't score many better goals" than his stunning strike.

title: Aguero ends 14-month wait for league goal as Man City win at Fulham
description: Sergio Aguero scores his first Premier League goal since January 2020 as Manchester City extend their lead at the top of the table with a win at struggling Fulham.

title: FA Cup final and World Snooker Championship on list of pilot events to test return of fans
description: The FA Cup final and the World Snooker Championship are among the proposed pilot events to test the return of big crowds to venues this year.

title: 'We would love to play like that every game' - Jones after dramatic England win over France
description: Head coach Eddie Jones says England wish every game was as entertaining as their win over France, but his side must learn to win ugly as well.

title: Mother's Day: How sustainable are the flowers you buy?
description: Most people are "oblivious" to the environmental impact of shop-bought cut flowers, a florist says.

title: Murray Walker: Formula 1 broadcasting legend dies at 97
description: Former Formula 1 commentator Murray Walker dies at the age of 97.

title: Wilfried Zaha has a right not to take a knee - Roy Hodgson
description: Crystal Palace manager Roy Hodgson says Wilfried Zaha has a right not to take a knee, after the forward said in February that he would no longer follow the initiative.

title: Formula 1 legend Murray Walker in his own words
description: Legendary Formula 1 commentator Murray Walker, who has died aged 97, explains why working in the sport meant so much to him, and friends and colleagues pay their own tributes.

title: Six Nations 2021: England 23-20 France - highlights
description: Watch the highlights as England come from behind to beat France and their Grand Slam hopes in a brilliant Six Nations encounter at Twickenham.

title: Murray Walker - a legend with effervescent enthusiasm
description: Legendary motor racing commentator, who became as famous as the drivers themselves, dies at 97

title: Cartoon SuperTed set for new animation series
description: The teddy with magic powers was a favourite among royal princes and a generation of children.

title: Sarah Everard: Wayne Couzens appears in court charged with murder
description: Wayne Couzens is charged with the kidnap and murder of the 33-year-old who disappeared in south London.

title: Sarah Everard: Clapham event to be replaced with doorstep vigil
description: Organisers urge people to stand on their doorsteps at 21:30 GMT to remember the 33-year-old.

title: Covid-19 pandemic: Italy to shut shops and schools amid infection spike
description: Most shops, restaurants and schools will be closed on Monday as Coronavirus infections rise.

title: Players Championship: England's Lee Westwood leads at Sawgrass after monster putt
description: England's Lee Westwood holes a sensational long-range putt as he cards a bogey-free six-under 66 to move into the halfway lead at the Players Championship at Sawgrass.

title: Mother's Day meet-ups planned as Wales lockdown eases
description: Up to four adults can now meet in a garden and the stay-at-home rule has changed to stay local.

title: Covid-19: Italy's 'new wave', and UK day of reflection
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday.

title: Target midfield, kick with care & snare 'Teflon' Dupont - how England can beat France
description: David Ellis, France's English defence coach for more than a decade, outlines five areas where unbeaten France can be defeated.

title: The Papers: Vigils 'to defy' ban and Easter jabs for over-40s
description: Developments in Sarah Everard's murder case and the planned vigils are carried in Saturday's papers.

title: Corinne Masiero: Actress protests naked at 'French Oscars' ceremony
description: Corinne Masiero sheds a donkey skin and bloodstained dress at a coronavirus-dominated César Awards.

title: Covid-19: UK national day of reflection to be held on 23 March
description: Politicians back a charity's plan to commemorate a year since the first national restrictions began.

title: Week in pictures: 6 - 12 March 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Tokyo 2020: The elite athletes training at home
description: Jacuzzi swims and pole vaulting over bins - getting ready for the Olympics and Paralympics has been creative.

title: Hungry, angry and fleeing the horrors of war in northern Mozambique
description: A BBC team are the first international journalists to reach an area besieged by Islamist militants.

title: Imagine Dragons: How a text saved singer Dan Reynolds' marriage
description: The singer was on his way to sign divorce papers when his wife sent a message that put them back on track.

title: Why the GameStop story is far from over
description: Huge swings in the share price show amateur investors are still taking on Wall Street.

title: India: How eating online is bringing women money - and freedom
description: Some Indian women are taking advantage of the popularity of online eating shows to become financially independent.

title: The Jaiy Twins: ‘We love proving people wrong’
description: Twin dancers Taitlyn and Kaylee Jaiy say discrimination as they were growing up made them hungrier to succeed.

title: Covid and schools: First week finished after children in England return
description: The BBC visited one school in Lincolnshire to see how its staff and children were coping on week one.

title: House builders 'should drop appalling gagging orders'
description: Developers who carry out repair work should not require non-disclosure agreements, says an MP.
